alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 12:52PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Bruneau River At Rowland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Moderate flooding. Impacts undetermined. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:55 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:55 AM PDT Wednesday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
